definition: change of dynasties/clear out the old, bring in the new
ancient cooking cauldron with two looped handles and three or four legs/pot (dialect)/to enter upon a period of (classical)/Kangxi radical 206/one of the 64 hexagrams of the Book of Changes
animal hide/leather/to reform/to remove/to expel (from office)

sentences.english: On the occasion of the Ming and Qing dynasty change, the family suffered heavy losses, many people died.
sentences.chinese: 明清鼎革之際，家族遭受重創，多人罹難。

definition: to transition to a new dynasty or regime
the Xin dynasty (8-23 AD) of Wang Mang 王莽, forming the interregnum between the former and later Han
to deteriorate/to decline/to slump/also written 凌夷
the situation (e.g. political)/the state of the world
Xinhai Revolution (1911), which ended the Qing Dynasty
to build (for the first time)/to create (a building)
first day of the first lunar month/(old) calendar promulgated by the first emperor of a dynasty
vestigial residue/a throwback (to a former age)
to propose/to put forward (an idea)/to initiate
